page.title: 15TRANSPORT
page.content: {Although this area is in a densely {settled part of Southern England and {only 5 miles from the town of Peters {field to the East and 20 miles from {the City of Portsmouth to the south, {its rural character & location in the {South Downs has resulted in it being {very poorly served by public transport {The nearest railway station is in {Petersfield,from where trains run to {London (Waterloo).Buses to the station {& to Winchester run about once every {hour during the week.However they only {serve East Meon & do not run after {8pm.As a result most people need to {have a car if they wish to travel out {of the area & many parents spend time {bussing their children to various {destinations.The council have to {provide buses to transport pupils to {Secondary School in Petersfield & to {6th Form College in Alton. }
